reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really fun indie platform/exploration game.
Love the art style and soundtrack.

So you are a french mafia member who has decided to go live in space.
He's definately french. Wine is health in this game.

It has a really interesting story.
You are trying to regain contact with your significant other.

The game is split up into two kinds of modes.
You spend some of your time on really small worlds.
This is where the platforming and combat take place.
There are many different types of worlds.
So far I have found Tree/Forest worlds and Ice planets.

The other side of the game is spent in the universe.
You explore this in your very steampunk styled ship.
You can mine asteroids and find loot as well as travel between different planets and ships.

Your main goal in this game seems to be collecting keys and maps.
When you find a map a new world or ship location will be revealed on the universe map.
Keys unlock chests which usually contain items and coins.
There are traders on ships who will sell you items and more maps.
The main story line seems to continue when you go to new ships and speak to people.

It's definately worth checking out.
The controls felt a little loose on the jumping side of things.
You get used to this pretty quickly.
It may just be more an issue with my ability at platforming than a problem with the game itself.

If you want to see some gameplay you can check out my video below.

Thanks for reading.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=671793308

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a very fun, but sometimes challenging puzzle game. Although with an early access game there are going to bug, but this has little effect on the game play.

Firstly I am going to talk about the character it's self. The character is obviously French, and not to mention that you need to drink wine to heal, which is also a big giveaway as to where the character is from, and if it wasn't enough the first cut scene is set in a somewhat of a look a like to Paris.

Secondly I would like to talk about Minion" the little character who follows you about as your travel to other planets/worlds. In my opinion in a game like this it is always good to have a character who follows you about. I'm going to use another game as an example to also describe this. So
date: for example take Portal 2 where you have the side character "Wheatley" following you about for most of the start of the game
recommended: until he takes control of GLaDOS body. Anyways getting back to this game
voteText: but sometimes annoying side character. Although

votesFunny: and will be fixed easily. The main one is the controls always reset everytime you go into to check them

reviewText:
Product received for free

So Long Earth feels like the strange, slightly twisted distant cousin of 'Don't Starve'
With a really nice bleak and washed art style(In a good way) and super immersive musical score, that at times, sounds like it could have been recorded by an actual orchestra.  So Long Earth creates a sort of weird, tense and dark atmosphere from the very start of the game.

I wasn't 100% sure that the protagonist was French, then I discovered that he must drink wine to heal. Case closed.

A really interesting, dark and mysterious game. If you like games that aren't the norm, check out So Long Earth.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nIt's a beautiful game with a very immersive soundtrack , I traveled so far by some worlds and I see the progression in the difficulty of the puzzles . I notice some problems in the game with gamepad that were reported to the developer who is already correcting . This game has a bright future and I look forward to play the final version !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

What to say about So Long Earth? It was really fun following with the development of this game, how the game evolve in time, and how is it today, and i can really say that is absolutely fantastic.
9/10
This game is absolutely lovely! You'll fall in love with this game! About the game play its simple but wont get boring, the combinations it gives your great. Its nice how do you complete the puzzles, find a secret places, etc.
The planets which you'll explore, they are unique! All of them have a nice level design and its secrets!
You've suits that change the way you play, it gives you a high jump, a fast one and other that give you a FLAMETHROWER! by far the best suit!
The music is another piece of art, nice match between the gameplay and history, the sound effects is funny sometimes.
Design art of this game you can only say thats is based in Don't Starve, and it is! but the characteristic of this game make it really unique and beautiful!

Really nice to play this game, and you won't get disappointed about it...and when you think the game is over, its just the start!

Early Access Review

9/10 – Travel space with your alien pal!

Not much of a reader? Watch my gameplay!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jVEbiwKGBXk

So Long Earth is a beautiful adventure game about a guy named Dominique traveling across the universe alongside his alien pal who I've named Timmy. The first thing you'll see is his girlfriend dumping him and throwing him a bottle of wine because he'll surely need" it. Turns out that you do need the wine because it'll numb the pain away - I mean
date: it's like your healing potion.\n\nYou'll get to ride an awesome spaceship in which you could also use to rub against (or mine) asteroids. In this game
recommended: you collect coins to buy more maps to progress. You could also buy wine and other things. It also includes some puzzles
hoursPlayed: which is always fun to figure out.\n\nWhile you travel from map to map
voteText: you'll encounter some enemies so prepare to kick butt before they kick yours!\n\nThe game art is similar to Don't Starve and Don't Starve together
helpfulPercent: which is what the developer was going for. I've read (on his twitter) that the game art is inspired by those games.\n\nNonetheless
votesHelpful: this game is fun to play and is definitely worth trying it out."

reviewText:
First game i've picked up in a while that i actually want to play for more than 5 mins.

Though it does require you to use your brain :)  not something i do with some other games but this one seems worth the effort plus it's fun and well made .
Definitely worth the time imho ,an original and interesting game.
An easy thumbs up from me.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game has a lot of great artwork in it, a lovely story and great music.
the developers obviously put a lot of work and effort into creating the characters and the world around it with a lot of passion for what they were doing. I really enjoy playing it and jumping around all the planets and trying to solve the puzzles on them.
Thanks to the developer who allowed me to do so, I even made a quick little video of the beginning of the game.
I hope to be able to play a lot more of the game in the future and I love to see what else the game holds for me to see.
https://youtu.be/b9IaDT_FlUU
